org.jasig.cas.util

Class DefaultCipherExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jasig.cas.util.DefaultCipherExecutor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CipherExecutor

    public final class DefaultCipherExecutor
extends Object
implements CipherExecutor
    The DefaultCipherExecutor is the default implementation of CipherExecutor. It provides a facade API to encrypt, sign, and verify values.
    Since:
    4.1
    Author:
    Misagh Moayyed

    • Constructor Detail

      • DefaultCipherExecutor

        public DefaultCipherExecutor(String secretKeyEncryption,
                     String secretKeySigning)
        Instantiates a new cipher.

        Note that in order to customize the encryption algorithms, you will need to download and install the JCE Unlimited Strength Jurisdiction Policy File into your Java installation.

        Parameters:
        secretKeyEncryption - the secret key encryption; must be represented as a octet sequence JSON Web Key (JWK)
        secretKeySigning - the secret key signing; must be represented as a octet sequence JSON Web Key (JWK)

      • DefaultCipherExecutor

        public DefaultCipherExecutor(String secretKeyEncryption,
                     String secretKeySigning,
                     String contentEncryptionAlgorithmIdentifier,
                     String signingAlgorithm)
        Instantiates a new cipher.
        Parameters:
        secretKeyEncryption - the key for encryption
        secretKeySigning - the key for signing
        contentEncryptionAlgorithmIdentifier - the content encryption algorithm identifier
        signingAlgorithm - the signing algorithm

    • Method Detail

      • encode

        public String encode(String value)
        Description copied from interface: CipherExecutor
        Encrypt the value. Implementations may choose to also sign the final value.
        Specified by:
        encode in interface CipherExecutor
        Parameters:
        value - the value
        Returns:
        the encrypted value or null

      • decode

        public String decode(String value)
        Description copied from interface: CipherExecutor
        Decode the value. Signatures may also be verified.
        Specified by:
        decode in interface CipherExecutor
        Parameters:
        value - encrypted value
        Returns:
        the decoded value.
